etymologies: 1940s: from endo- ‘within’ + Greek odous, odont- ‘tooth’, on the pattern of orthodontic

definitions: denoting or relating to the soft tissues inside a tooth (the dental pulp)

examples.text: endodontic treatment is necessary when the nerve inside the tooth is harmed
the treatment is challenging due to the involvement of both periodontal and endodontic tissues

shortDefinitions: denoting or relating to soft tissues inside tooth
